result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L. Gholson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and 0 days credit. Consecutive to existing sentence.
Consecutive to: existing jail sentence

Due to the Richland County Sheriff's Department and ordered as a civil judgment with the Defendant as the Debtor and the Sheriff's Department as the creditor. Clerk of Court will make attempts to collect this debt if it remains unpaid.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CM160 and 17CM23. These were on the calendar for status. Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA notes she declined to prosecute on a third matter that was to be filed by today. DA states resolution whereby def will plead to count 1/crim. damage to property as repeater for 120 days jail, consecutive to current sentence, 0 days credit, rest. $1000 as civil jgt. Atty. Frank addresses Court; notes def is currently serving a sentence and out on huber. DA notes State takes no position on release; that is a matter for sheriff to determine. Def pleads guilty to count 1 in 16CM160. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty. Sentence: 120 days jail with huber, costs, 0 days credit, $1000 rest. to civil jgt (Richland County as creditor). 17CM23 dismissed and read in. Bond vacated in the unfiled case. Sentence consecutive to that already serving.
Defendants demand for disclosure and motion for discovery
Status conference on March 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.

10:05 a.m.  Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Timothy James Gaskell appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin in 15CM197/sentencing after revocation.  ADA Amy Forehand appears for the State of Wisconsin for 15CM132/sentencing after revocation, 15CF92/sentencing after revocation, 16CF79/sentencing after revocation, and 17CM23 and 16CM160/adjourned initial.

DA Gaskell addresses the Court in 15CM197.  ADA Forehand addresses the Court in the other sentencing after rev cases.  Atty. Frank addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.

Sentence after revocation: 

15CM197 - Count 1 and 2, both battery:  9 months year jail both counts, concurrent.  

15CM92 - Counts 2 (disorderly conduct) and 4 (bail jumping):  Count 2 - 90 days, consecutive to Counts 1 and 2 of 15CM197; Count 4 - 9 months concurrent with all ofother charges

15CM132 - Count 2, criminal damage to property with d.a. enhancer:  9 months concurrent with all other charges

16CF79 - Count 1, bail jumping:  9 months concurrent with all other charges.

Credit:  52 days credit on everything except for Count 2 of 15CM92.

Costs have already been imposed; any remaining now as civil judgment.

Adjourned initials in 17CM23 and 16CM160 - formal reading waived.  NG previously entered in 16CM160; entered now also in 17CM23, def having stood mute.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Status requested and set for 3/29 at 9:00.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Several cases called together, four of them subject to revocation:  16CF79, 15CM197, 15CM132, and 15CF92.  Also called:  new filing 17CM23 and adjourned initial 16CM160. 

In 15CM197, special prosecutor Tim Gaskell appears by phone for the State.  In all of the other cases, ADA Forehand appears for the State.  Defendant appears in custody for all matters, appearing today without counsel.  It has been noted that Def is presently without counsel while SPD looks for an attorney who can take the cases despite numerous conflicts between the cases and co-defendants.  

Def states that he wants to proceed to sentencing after rev in the 4 revoked cases.  ADA Forehand notes rev order/warrant just came through; State is not prepared to go forward with sentencing today.  

Court resets all matters to 2/10 at 10.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Unfiled case called, State asks for $10k sig bond. Court orders $10,000 signature bond.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  In 16CM160, def waives formal reading of charges. Court states charges and informs def of max possbile penalties and his rights. Def enters not guilty plea.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

3:44 p.m.  Defendant Allen L. Gholson now appears in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  The Court earlier today ordered a warrant due to his non-appearance for the time this matter was set.  Warrant quashed.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Atty. McDougal requests adjournment.  Court resets to adjourned initial Jan. 11th at 3:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

11:48 a.m.  Defendant Allen L. Gholson not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  This matter was set for AIA at 11.  Due to non-appearance of Def, DA requests warrant.  So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Allen L. Gholson in court, having turned himself in today following missed appearance yesterday. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin; asks for warrant to be quashed.  Court quashes the warrant and resets matter to 12/14 at 11 a.m.  Bond reinstated.  Def to contact SPD office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
4:24 p.m.  Matter was calendared for 3:30 today.  Defendant did not appear.  DA requested a warrant.  Court so ordered.
